visualization_prompt: Generate a combined scatter and spline chart showing the relationship between measured noisy data and the expected sine wave function using synthetic data generation with mathematical modeling.
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two series with 1000 points each, representing numerical relationships between X and Y values. The measured data combines a base sine wave (y = sin(x/10)) with uniform noise (±0.5), while the expected series shows the pure mathematical function. Synthetic data was generated programmatically with controlled noise parameters to maintain statistical validity while preserving the underlying pattern. The scatter plot reveals measurement density and variance, while the spline emphasizes the theoretical relationship. This dual encoding adheres to Tufte's data-ink ratio by maximizing meaningful graphical elements and follows Cairo's principles of truthfulness through accurate positional encoding. The measured data (μ=sin(x/10), noise range ±0.5) demonstrates controlled variance around the expected values (σ≈0.29 for uniform distribution), creating visual distinction between empirical observations and theoretical predictions while maintaining mathematical integrity.
